result.execSummary:
The defendant Damion M. Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2016CM000121

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma (HSED) during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Time served sentence with application of Good Time and credit for prior time served.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case Nos. 2016CF000221 and 2016CM000121

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 16CF-221, 16CM-61 and 16CM-121 - All Cases Called @ 11:37 AM: Defendant Damion M. Johnston in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint agreement on SEH recommendation recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Statement by Def prior to SEH.  The Court:  Will follow joint recommendation.  16CM-61 and 16CM-121:  6 mos WCJ - concurrent terms and with TS credit for 169 days.  Court Costs not fulfilled reimposed - 60 DTP or PP.  16CF- 221: 10 mos WCJ - with 81 days TS credit and Court Costs reimposed.  GT and Work Release privileges granted.   Concurrent terms on all cases.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 27, 2017 at 11:30 am.

16CM-61 and 16CM-121 with companion citations - All Cases Called @ 11:15 AM: Defendant Damion M. Johnston in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  SPD and Def confirm State's resolution.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea 16CM-61 Illegal RX: NC  Plea 16CM-121 Ct 1 POT: NC.  16TR-340 OWI:  NC    Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  16CM-61 Ct 2 and 16CM-121 Ct 2 both DRI, 16TR-341 and 16TR-342 All DRI.  In the event of any Refusal 343.305 citation, either issued in the past or potentially in the future, deemed DRI as part of this resolution.  Statement by Def:  Yes - agrees with probation and AODA.  The Court:   As to Ct 1 of both cases - S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:  Complete AODA and any follow thru,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; obtain an HSED; Court Costs as to each count - 60 DTP or PP - bond to apply from 16CM-121; May petition the Court with approval of Agent at any time after completion of 18 mos - must have HSED and programming completed.  16TR-340 - $811.50 forfeiture - 60 DTP or PP; 6 mos DL Rev, effective today; No requirement for IID; OWI assessment prior to any relicensing.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Damion M. Johnston in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Szilagyi requesting another date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states matter resolved requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on May 25, 2016 at 03:55 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 03:55 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:12 p.m. Defendant Damion M. Johnston in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position on bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered as to all matters including companion citations.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
